Witness divine rituals, immerse in spiritual serenity, and marvel at exquisite sculptures. Discover sacred sanctuaries, symbolising devotion and tranquillity, offering solace amidst bustling city life. Experience spiritual enlightenment and cultural richness in Ahmedabad's revered temples. Team Digit Table of Contents Best Temples to Visit in Ahmedabad Swaminarayan Akshardham Temple Jagannath Temple Hatkeshwar Mahadev Temple Iskcon Temple Shree Camp Hanuman Mandir Vaishno Devi Temple Shree Mahakali Maa Temple Prem Mandir Dholeshwar Mahadev Temple Modhera Sun Temple Frequently Asked Questions List of Temples in Ahmedabad Following is the list of temples in Ahmedabad that are easily accessible via the Ahmedabad Junction Railway Station, Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport, and the GSRTC Ahmedabad Central Bus Station: Temples Location Swaminarayan Akshardham Temple Gandhinagar Highway Jagannath Temple Jamalpur Hatkeshwar Mahadev Temple Khokhra Iskcon Temple Satellite Shree Camp Hanuman Mandir Camp Road Vaishno Devi Temple Sarkhej Shree Mahakali Maa Temple Kalupur Prem Mandir Bodakdev Dholeshwar Mahadev Temple Dholka Modhera Sun Temple Modhera, Mehsana district Read more about: Road trips from Ahmedabad One day trip from Ahmedabad What is Ahmedabad famous for 10 Best Temples to Visit in Ahmedabad Explore the top 10 temples in Ahmedabad: 1. Swaminarayan Akshardham Temple | Gandhinagar Highway Experience architectural grandeur amidst serene surroundings. Embrace spiritual solace amidst intricate carvings and sacred rituals. A testament to timeless devotion and cultural heritage awaits on Gandhinagar Highway. Best Time to Visit: November to January. Temple Timings: 9:00 am to 7:00 pm - Everyday. Nearby Places: Adalaj Stepwell, Indroda Nature Park, and Sarita Udhyan.   Read more about: Weekend getaways from Ahmedabad Hill stations near Ahmedabad 2. Jagannath Temple | Jamalpur Experience spiritual serenity at a renowned temple, embodying ancient traditions and architectural splendour. Delve into divine rituals amidst tranquil surroundings, immersing in centuries-old cultural heritage and religious devotion. Best Time to Visit: October to March. Temple Timings: 5:00 am to 12:00 pm, 4:00 pm to 9:00 pm - Everyday. Nearby Places: Kankaria Lake, Sidi Saiyyed Mosque, and Sabarmati Ashram.   Know more about: Waterfalls near Ahmedabad Best places to visit in Ahmedabad 3. Hatkeshwar Mahadev Temple | Khokhra Hatkeshwar Mahadev Temple in Khokhra, Ahmedabad, stands as a beacon of divine serenity. Adorned with intricate architecture and spiritual ambience, it offers solace to devotees seeking blessings and peace in the heart of the bustling city. Best Time to Visit: February To March. Temple Timings: 6:00 am to 9:00 pm - Everyday. Nearby Places: Maniar's Wonderland, Lalbhai Dalpatbhai Museum, and Kankaria Zoo. 4. Iskcon Temple | Satellite The ISKCON Temple, situated in the Satellite area of Ahmedabad, is a renowned spiritual landmark. It embodies architectural grandeur and a serene ambience, offering devotees and visitors a tranquil sanctuary for prayer and reflection. Best Time to Visit: October to March. Temple Timings: 4:30 am to 10:00 pm - Everyday. Nearby Places: Sardar Patel Stadium, Law Garden, and Vastrapur Lake. 5. Shree Camp Hanuman Mandir | Camp Road Visit Shree Camp Hanuman Mandir on Camp Road for a serene spiritual experience. This temple, dedicated to Lord Hanuman, exudes tranquillity and reverence. Its architectural beauty and divine ambience draw devotees seeking solace and blessings in Ahmedabad. Best Time to Visit: October to March. Temple Timings: 6:00 am to 8:00 pm - Everyday. Nearby Places: Auto World Vintage Car Museum, Gujarat Science City, and Nal Sarovar Bird Sanctuary. 6. Vaishno Devi Temple | Sarkhej Located in Sarkhej, the Vaishno Devi Temple is a beacon of faith and devotion. Its tranquil ambience and intricate architecture draw devotees seeking spiritual solace. Embrace the sacred atmosphere and delve into the essence of divine grace. Best Time to Visit: September to March. Temple Timings: 5:00 am to 9:00 pm - Everyday. Nearby Places: Sarkhej Roza, Sabarmati Riverfront, and Thol Bird Sanctuary. 7. Shree Mahakali Maa Temple | Kalupur The Shree Mahakali Maa Temple, located in Kalupur, stands as a testament to the city's religious fervour. Devotees flock to this sacred site to seek blessings and solace, immersing themselves in its spiritual ambience and timeless rituals. Best Time to Visit: March to April. Temple Timings: 5:00 am to 10:00 pm - Everyday. Nearby Places: Kankaria Lake, Sidi Bashir Mosque, and Manek Chowk. 8. Prem Mandir | Bodakdev Prem Mandir in Bodakdev epitomizes divine splendour, boasting intricate architecture and a serene ambience. Devotees flock to this spiritual sanctuary to immerse in prayers and seek solace. Experience transcendental bliss amidst ornate surroundings. Best Time to Visit: December to March. Temple Timings: 7:00 am to 9:00 pm - Everyday. Nearby Places: Sabarmati Ashram, Law Garden, and AlphaOne Mal. 9. Dholeshwar Mahadev Temple | Dholka The Dholeshwar Mahadev Temple in Dholka is a revered Hindu pilgrimage site known for its tranquil ambience and spiritual significance. Devotees flock here to seek blessings and immerse themselves in the divine presence of Lord Shiva. Best Time to Visit: July to October. Temple Timings: 5:00 am to 10:00 pm - Everyday. Nearby Places: Lothal Archaeological Site, Balasinor Fossil Park, and Nalsarovar Bird Sanctuary. 10. Modhera Sun Temple | Modhera, Mehsana district Visit the Modhera Sun Temple, located in the Mehsana district of Ahmedabad. This architectural marvel showcases intricate carvings and timeless design, offering a glimpse into ancient Hindu craftsmanship and spiritual devotion. Best Time to Visit: October to March. Temple Timings: 6:00 am to 6:00 pm - Everyday. Nearby Places: Rani Ki Vav, Patan, and Sun Modhera Rd, Ambaji. Ahmedabad boasts a rich cultural heritage, punctuated by its renowned temples that reflect architectural grandeur and spiritual significance. From intricately carved facades to serene sanctums, each temple offers a glimpse into the city's religious tapestry. These sacred sites draw devotees and tourists alike, embodying Ahmedabad's spiritual essence. Yes, mobile phones are allowed in Akshardham Temple Ahmedabad, but their usage may be restricted in certain areas. Visiting Akshardham Temple Ahmedabad typically takes around 2-3 hours to thoroughly explore its various exhibits and attractions. Visiting Akshardham Temple Ahmedabad typically takes around 2-3 hours to thoroughly explore its various exhibits and attractions. How much is the boat ride in Akshardham Temple? No, the boat ride in Akshardham Temple Ahmedabad is usually included in the entry ticket, and there is no separate charge. No, the boat ride in Akshardham Temple Ahmedabad is usually included in the entry ticket, and there is no separate charge. Which God is famous in Ahmedabad? Lord Krishna is famous in Ahmedabad, and numerous temples are dedicated to him throughout the city. Lord Krishna is famous in Ahmedabad, and numerous temples are dedicated to him throughout the city. What is special about Stambheshwar Mahadev Temple? Stambheshwar Mahadev Temple is famous for its unique natural phenomenon, which is when the temple disappears and reappears with the tides of the Arabian Sea. Stambheshwar Mahadev Temple is famous for its unique natural phenomenon, which is when the temple disappears and reappears with the tides of the Arabian Sea. Why is Jagannath Rath Yatra celebrated in Ahmedabad? Jagannath Rath Yatra is celebrated in Ahmedabad to commemorate Lord Jagannath's journey to his aunt's house, and it's a significant festival for Hindus. Jagannath Rath Yatra is celebrated in Ahmedabad to commemorate Lord Jagannath's journey to his aunt's house, and it's a significant festival for Hindus. What is Rath Yatra's route in Ahmedabad? The route of Rath Yatra in Ahmedabad typically starts from the Jagannath Temple and passes through various parts of the city before returning. The route of Rath Yatra in Ahmedabad typically starts from the Jagannath Temple and passes through various parts of the city before returning. What is not allowed in Akshardham Temple? Items like mobile phones, cameras, electronic gadgets, food, and drinks are not allowed in Akshardham Temple Ahmedabad. Items like mobile phones, cameras, electronic gadgets, food, and drinks are not allowed in Akshardham Temple Ahmedabad. What are the rules for visiting Vaishno Devi Temple? Rules for visiting Vaishno Devi Temple include carrying proper identity proof, wearing modest attire, and maintaining cleanliness and discipline throughout the pilgrimage. Rules for visiting Vaishno Devi Temple include carrying proper identity proof, wearing modest attire, and maintaining cleanliness and discipline throughout the pilgrimage. Are mobile phones permitted inside the temple premises? Yes, mobile phones are allowed, but they should be on silent mode or switched off during prayers. Yes, mobile phones are allowed, but they should be on silent mode or switched off during prayers. Can visitors capture video footage inside the temple? Yes, with permission.
